content: Hi, in #24116 I had to fix one of the proofs for a reason I don't understand: the old proof caused a simp cycle but I don't understand why a ≠ a.succAbove (last n) appears in the chain. Help is appreciated.

I think this is because succAbove_ne_last_last (unapplied) is still a simp lemma, and so Lean tries to apply it in the forward direction, which makes the a ≠ a.succAbove (last n) side-goal appear. And now, unlike before, that side-goal is closable, so the forward rewrite succeeds. But the backwards rewrite from the applied version of that lemma also succeeds, creating a loop. See also #lean4 > lean#4290 Closed simp tries using the forward version of use
